title: In regular-season finale, Michigan poked holes throughout Maryland men’s soccer’s defense
author: Eric Myers

image.alt: Defender Ben Di Rosa (25) closes down on a loose ball in Maryland men’s soccer’s 4-2 loss to Michigan on Nov. 3, 2019. (Richard Moglen/The Diamondback)

blurb:
As Michigan forward Jack Hallahan dribbled uninhibited toward the 18-yard box, Maryland men’s soccer coach Sasho Cirovski yelled from the sideline, “It’s too easy.”

Hallahan pushed a pass out to the wing for Nebojsa Popovic’s cross, which was redirected just high in the 50th minute of the Wolverines’ 4-2 victory on Sunday at Ludwig Field.

The Terps’ defense could breathe a sigh of relief in what was then a 2-2 game, but Michigan’s go-ahead strike seemed imminent with the time and space Maryland afforded.
